project.name: simon says
project.notes: Play Simon Says using your webcam. Do what you are instructed only if Simon says to. Requires speakers or headphones and a webcam. Runs best in Chrome. Please send questions, suggestions, and bug reports to toontalk@gmail.com

custom-block.l: Wait until you see your pose in the camera before returning to Snap!

list.l: Do what Simon says but only what he says and before the time runs out.
The first time you play this a new panel will open where you can see your pose.
Click the green flag to play again.
You can return to the panel by pressing the space bar.

custom-block.comment: The number is how many seconds you have to respond.

block.comment: Space bar will display posenet window.

block-definition.s: Simon says workhorse %'Simon said' %'stop time' %'body part 1' %'body part 2' %'instructions' %'seconds to reply'

block.comment: If posenet window was just created reset the timer since shouldn't count the time to load the posenet window.

custom-block.s: touching body parts %l and %l in pose %l

custom-block.l: Correct! But Simon didn't say to do that!
You did right. Since Simon didn't say.

custom-block.comment: Get a new pose and run this again. But nothing to say this time.

block-definition.s: touching body parts %'body part 1' and %'body part 2' in pose %'pose'

block-definition.comment: This reports a list of poses captured by the camera. There are 'pose property' reporters for inspecting the values in a pose.
This reports either the location of a body part as two numbrs between 0 and 100 or the confidence that the body part is correctly identified as a number between 0 and 100.

input.options: confidence it is a person - 0 confidence there is a nose - 1 location of nose - 2 confidence there is a left eye - 3 location of left eye - 4 confidence there is a right eye - 5 location of right eye - 6 confidence there is a left ear - 7 location of left ear - 8 confidence there is a right ear - 9 location of right ear - 10 confidence there is a left shoulder - 11 location of leff shoulder - 12 confidence there is a right shoulder - 13 location of right shoulder - 14 confidence there is a left elbow - 15 location of left elbow - 16 confidence there is a right elbow - 17 location of right elbow - 18 confidence there is a left wrist - 19 location of left wrist - 20 confidence there is a right wrist - 21 location of right wrist - 22 confidence there is a left hip - 23 location of left hip - 24 confidence there is a right hip - 25 location of right hip - 26 confidence there is a left knee - 27 location of left knee - 28 confidence there is a right knee - 29 location of right knee - 30 confidence there is a left ankle - 31 location of left ankle - 32 confidence there is a right ankle - 33 location of right ankle - 34

block.comment: 'property name' ends with hypen and a number and this extracts that number. Add 0 to ensure it is a number and not text.

block-definition.s: pose property %'location or confidence' of %'left or right' %'body part' from %'pose'
block-definition.comment: This reports either the location of a body part as two numbrs between 0 and 100 or the confidence that the body part is correctly identified as a number between 0 and 100.

input.options: eye ear shoulder elbow wrist hip knee ankle nose person

block.comment: Only the nose has no left or right versions.

custom-block.comment: Property numbers range from 0 to 34 to identify different information in a pose.

block.comment: Confidence that there is a person at all.
Location extracted from [["x" 1] ["y" 2]]. Coordinates adjusted to go from 0 to 100.

block-definition.comment: Use the browser's default voice or Mary TTS to speak the 'message'.
Reports whether the selected support panel is visible.

inputs.input: training using cameratraining using camera training using microphone posenet

block-definition.comment: Reports whether the selected support panel is ready to answer queries from Snap!.

inputs.input: training using cameratraining using camera training using microphone posenet

block-definition.comment: Make previously opened selected support panel visible.

inputs.input: training using cameratraining using camera training using microphone posenet

block-definition.s: Setup camera %'width' %'height' then when ready %'do when camera is ready'
block-definition.comment: Specifies the resolution of the image sent for recogntion.
Returns only after eCraft2Learn library is loaded
Should only be called by Load eCraft2Learn library

block.l: if (typeof ecraft2learn === 'object') { return true; } if (window.waiting_for_ecraft2learn_library) { return false; } window.waiting_for_ecraft2learn_library = true; let script = document.createElement("script"); script.type = "text/javascript"; if (window.location.hostname === 'localhost') { script.src = window.location.protocol + "//" + window.location.host + "/ai/ecraft2learn-beta.js"; // notice this the beta version } else { script.src = "https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/ecraft2learn.js"; } document.head.appendChild(script); return false;

if (typeof ecraft2learn === 'object') { ecraft2learn.run(function_name, parameters); } else { var script = document.createElement("script"); script.type = "text/javascript"; script.addEventListener('error', function () { alert("Unable to load https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/ecraft2learn.js. Check your network connection."); }); script.src = "https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/ecraft2learn.js"; script.addEventListener('load', function () { ecraft2learn.run(function_name, parameters); }); document.head.appendChild(script); }

if (typeof ecraft2learn === 'object') { return ecraft2learn.run(function_name, parameters); } if (!no_warning) { alert("Any eCraft2Learn command must be run before the " + function_name + " reporter."); } return 0;

custom-block.comment: Check if already ready to avoid the 1 second wait

block.comment: Wait a bit more because otherwise a black image is captured.

block-definition.comment: Reports a costume using the camera.
